direction.raw_text: listens, for some unknown reason to MARISSA this catches her imagination. The phone rings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frau Wiegler, this is reception. I have one Erik Heller for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stops dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put him on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) You were supposed to be dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So were you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARK. COPENHAGEN - NIGHT 143 A phone booth in a city park. ERIK shivering in the cold as icy rain falls around him, he's holding the CELLPHONE he stole from the dead SPECIAL OPS. HELLER'S leg is bleeding profusely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, here we are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did you know I was here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I killed one of your men. Got his cellphone. You've gotten soft.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) No, I just grew up. The world's changed since you died.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got kids?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HOTEL SUITE. COPENHAGEN - CONTINUOUS 144 MARISSA stops, taken aback by the question.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I made choices.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hanna's practically yours, you know? This goes straight to an ache that's been building in
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not interested. But she is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's true and good and funny. Yeah, she's funny. She's special. You should see her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm looking forward to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll have to catch her first. The line goes dead. MARISSA puts the phone down and sits quietly for a moment. Then presses play again on the tape machine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Was it like this for you, Mama? I think I know what the baby looks like. I think it's a girl -- I hope so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INDUSTRIAL ROAD - NIGHT 145 The FAMILY'S van drives - behind ISAACS BMW tails it, lights on high beam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) I wonder who she'll be? I hope she's smart. I hope she's a stronger person than I am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . VAN - NIGHT 146 HANNA sits beside her in the passenger seat, her anxiety growing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is still at the wheel, watching the bright headlights behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit. Shit, shit, shit. I think we're lost, Hanna.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: checks the side view mirror again and sees ISAACS BMW. She's knows that whoever is driving that car is after her. She looks back and sees SEB, SOPHIE and MILES all comfortably asleep. MILES' fingers wrapped around a Transformers toy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to pull over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need to check the map.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAR/CONTAINER PARK - NIGHT 147 The van slowly pulls in at the side of the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: waits for the BMW behind to pass but instead it pulls in behind the van. On either side of the road is an enormous container park. The containers are piled on top of each other like a giant baby's building blocks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why won't that car pass? He has his lights on high beam, I was doing everything I could to get out of the way...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: wakes up in the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are we stopped? I need to pee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I don't want you going too far right now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you should stay where you are, Sophie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: doesn't take her eyes off the mirror. She can see the silhouettes of ISAACS and his MEN. They don't move and neither does HANNA. Both are waiting for the other to make the first move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hanna, what's going on. Seb wake up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is creepy. You're creeping me out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are we in Lille?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. But you really mustn't get out of the van.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: climbs into the back of the van and comes very close to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What ever you do, don't follow me. Promise not to follow me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I promise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hanna, tell me what's going on or Seb will go over to that car and find out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like fuck I will. Everyone stay put. Where's my phone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you for being my friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks back at the BMW. All at once all four of the car doors open. In a flash, HANNA pulls open the van's side door and bolts from the van.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hanna!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sees ISAACS and one of the HENCHMEN chase after HANNA. The SECOND HENCHMAN appears at her drivers window aiming his gun at her head. RACHEL screams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTAINER PARK - NIGHT 148 HANNA sprints across hard tarmac heading for the relative safety of the container park.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and his HENCHMAN follow at speed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: enters a dark gully between two enormous containers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: slips around the other side to block her off. He signals to the HENCHMAN to loop around and flank HANNA.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: moves quietly between the containers, turning this way and that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: voice comes echoing through the maze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Don't be a silly girl, Hanna. You need to come with me now. I know where your papa is. She listens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: his gun in hand, calls out again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He wants to talk to you, Hanna. He misses you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The HENCHMAN appears directly behind HANNA. HANNA double- kicks him in the chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pulls herself up the side of the containers and scrambles on top of them and runs, jumping between the containers when she reaches a gap. The HENCHMAN appears having climbed up too. A chase ensues. HANNA, followed by the HENCHMAN climbing up higher, now four containers high.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: follow below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: jumps an enormous gap between two containers and right over the head of ISAACS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: slips and tumbles but catches the edge of one of the containers on her way down. She hangs there a moment, then pushes herself off the side of the container and manages to land on a lower container on the other side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: running across the tops of the containers sees the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: appear at the far edge. She grabs a discarded wrench and throws it at the man, catching him in the side of the head - a perfect aim - and he tumbles to the ground. She descends the containers with nimble leaps and comes to the ground. She's running now through a maze of tight alleys between the containers. She stops at a a T' junction, unsure which way to go. Suddenly ISAACS appears at the end of one alley, HENCHMAN ONE at the end of another, and HENCHMAN TWO at the end of the third. She's trapped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just take it easy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: makes her decision and runs straight at ISAACS. He stretches out his arms in an attempt to catch her. She hits him like a bowling ball hitting the last pin and he crashes to the ground. She rolls and springs to her feet. The HENCHMEN follow but HANNA is too quick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCRAP METAL YARD/CANAL - NIGHT 149 HANNA sprints full tilt out of the container park and through a scrap metal yard. Either side of her rise mountains of waste.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: reaches the edge of an industrial canal from where the scrap metal is unloaded.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A large industrial barge is passing beneath. HANNA jumps and lands on the moving barge. Then quickly takes cover under a tarpaulin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HOLDING CELLS. DAWN 150 Four holding cells in a row, each one holding a member of the family.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: paces around his cell. RACHEL sits stoically in hers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is crying in her cell while MILES is playing with his Nintendo in his cell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: walks into SOPHIE'S cell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you please stop crying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not telling you anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honey, your friend is in a lot of danger. You need to help us find her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know where to find her!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: grits her teeth, shows SOPHIE a photo of FELICIANO.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He knows you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: now in RACHEL'S cell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We gave her a ride because we thought she was in trouble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you knew she didn't have a passport. You smuggled her into port and helped her illegally gain
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She said she lived in Leipzig. She went to the Klaus Kohle Gymnasium.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is no Klaus Kohle Gymnasium. It closed five years ago. Shock on Rachel's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did she give any idea of where she was going? Rachel wracks her brains.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She said she was going home, to Leipzig. She seemed lost. Like she needed taking care of. (woman to woman) You understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shows her the photograph of JOANNA ZADEK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This was Hanna's mother, Joanna Zadek. Fifteen years ago Hanna's father shot her to death on a camping holiday by the Baltic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: swallows, goes pale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: now in SEB'S cell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was odd. I'll give you that. Disconnected. I mean I get on with most kids, you know, have a rapport. But, this one -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, Mr Lyall, it's days like these that I really hate my job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure you do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a very, very difficult thing to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Absolutely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But sometimes children are bad people too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in MILES'S cell. MILES is terrified of MARISSA. She puts her hand out and strokes his hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not going to hurt you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shrinks from her touch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miles is a nice name. Are you a nice boy? She strokes MILES' hair and immediately he starts crying loudly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pounds on the wall from his cell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey what's going on in there? We don't have to put up with this! We're in the EU, Goddammit!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BARGE. RURAL FRANCE INTO GERMANY. DAWN 151 HANNA watches as the sun rises over the misty fields either side be the canal. It's a beautiful sight. HANNA is strangely peaceful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HOLDING CELLS. DAWN 152 Now the whole family are reunited in MILES' cell. He sniffs and plays with his Nintendo. The others look wan as MARISSA passes around a photo of the two dead DANISH POLICEMEN. The family go silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three days ago Hanna's father killed two Danish policemen on a beach with a hunting knife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is he now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's still at large and he's still very dangerous. We need to find Hanna before he does. Pause. SOPHIE thinks about it but clams up. Marissa notices.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you know anything at all, it's vital you tell us for her own safety. We are now very worried about her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . But SOPHIE doesn't say a word.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sophie? Still nothing. They all look at her. MILES suddenly speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's going to Berlin. To Wilhelm Grimm's house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You little bastard!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did you know that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You fuckwad!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: slaps MILES over the back of the head but SEB pushes her back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey hey hey! Sophie for God's sake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BERLIN CANALS - DAY 153 HANNA'S sits on the prow of the barge as it makes it's slow progress into Berlin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAR/STREET - DAY 154 MARISSA looks out at a school playground as she waits in the back of her car. The passenger door next to her opens and ISAACS gets in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've looked through Heller's contacts from the 1980's. There's no one called Wilhelm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wilhelm Grimm wrote fairy-tales. He died two hundred years ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hands ISAACS a brown envelope containing one of the photographs she took from KATRIN'S apartment. The photograph shows a happy looking JOANNA and ERIK at a busy family amusement park. Between ERIK and JOANNA is a clown, his arms around both of them. This we will come to understand is KLAUS KNEPFLER. Behind them is a GRIMM'S BROTHERS HOUSE OF FUN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell is this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles slightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wilhelm's house. (to the DRIVER) Drive on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BERLIN STREETS - DAY 155 HANNA wanders through the skyscrapers and glass constructions of Berlin. People swarm around her but pay her no mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TRAM - DAY 156 HANNA is riding a tram to the outskirts of town.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ABANDONNED AMUSEMENT PARK - DAY 157 HANNA walks beside a wire mesh fence that separates her from an abandoned amusement park. Behind her is an enormous steel works from which great industrial plumes of steam rise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: climbs under the fence and walks through this surreal playground long since reclaimed by nature. There are huge fibreglass dinosaurs toppled over with heads missing and abandoned dinosaur legs. Rising above the park, surrounded by a muddy moat, is the big wheel now standing at a vertiginous angle. In front of the big wheel is the WILHELM GRIMM HOUSE. The house is a Grimm Brothers fairytale theme a Fun House'. It's windows long since shuttered, vines growing through its roof.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stands in front of the house in deep anticipation. She walks up the small steps that lead to the front door and knocks. She waits, heart sinking at the thought of there being no-one home. Then, ever so slightly the door opens and peering out at her is a man with the sad face of an out of work clown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me young lady? It is the man from the photo, but twenty years older. Small, with a wiry intensity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you Wilhelm Grimm?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not exactly, but it'll do for now. Come this way. He leads her inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WILHELM GRIMM'S HOUSE - DAY 158 They come inside - it's old and full of hoarded junk, antiques, boxes, books, dusty china, lamps, figurines, but still functional - an old man's home. He stops to look at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you are Hanna. He puts out his hand to shake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's very nice to meet you, Hanna.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles and shakes his hand, she likes him already.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: studies her, quietly moved by his memories.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My real name is Knepfler. Herr Knepfler. I'm an old friend of your father's. I am a sort of acaretakera here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened to it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No car park. You need a car park these days, otherwise people wont come. But somebody has to watch over it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's beautiful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like it too. Erik used to come here a great deal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you heard from him? He nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must wait. He will be here soon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares, not quite believing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares out the window, thinking all this through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: leads HANNA through a reception area and under a spider with a human face that straddles a door to a run down kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KITCHEN. WILHELM GRIMM'S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS 159 HANNA follows KNEPFLER into the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, sit down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits at the old kitchen table on a wooden bench, while
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: goes to the stove.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you like an egg? They're fresh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: takes an egg, breaks it and swallows it raw.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles. He gives her a buff envelope. She looks inside - some money, a passport, ID cards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll need a fresh photograph. Don't get it wet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at the passport with a new name - ANNA-MARIE ELKAN. She takes a deep breath, not really comprehending.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't really understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Identity. It tells people who you are. She stares at the passport with the blank space for her photo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is an apartment ready for you in the south. Erik will come and the car will take you there today. You will live there now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do I have to?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you want to?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. I miss the forest. I miss my home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's to be expected. But the city is so exciting, don't you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I suppose. She drinks her water, thinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you know my mother?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was she like?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was very gentle, she was very funny, very talented - a singer - did you know that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She had your eyes. He smiles at her. She here's a noise outside and runs to look out the window. She sees ISAACS BMW pull up outside the house followed by a second car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: leads HANNA out of the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WILHELM GRIMM'S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS 160 The driver of the second car gets out and opens the back door for MARISSA. She gets out and looks up at the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RECEPTION. WILHELM GRIMM'S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS 161 KNEPFLER points HANNA towards a set of stairs that lead up from the reception.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Upstairs. There's a knock at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: begins to climb the stairs while KNEPFLER approaches the front door. There's another knock at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GRANDMA'S ROOM. WILHELM GRIMM'S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS 162 HANNA enters a room that's been designed to look like Grandma's bedroom from Little Red Riding Hood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hurriedly slides under the bed. Breathing as quietly as she can. She can hear the sound of ISAAC'S MEN starting to spread through the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.O.V) Listen to me, listen. There is no one here. There is nobody up there...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.C.) Check the attic. Footsteps to the attic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WILHELM GRIMM'S HOUSE/STARS - DAY 163 MARISSA has KNEPFLER cornered on the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Erik Heller? Do you know him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have never heard of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shows him the photograph of JOANNA, ERIK and KNEPFLER outside the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know these people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think very carefully He shrugs and MARISSA grabs KNEPFLER by the throat. He speaks in gasps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He called me. She's coming soon. To meet him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tomorrow! Tomorrow morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: lets him go. She turns to ISAACS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take him in there. Find out what he knows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GRANDMA'S ROOM. WILHELM GRIMM'S HOUSE - DAY 164 The sound of KNEPFLER being escorted into a next-door room, the door shutting. The sound of footsteps coming into the room. HANNA silent under the bed. MARISSA'S GREEN SHOES are in sight, nothing else. The green shoes come close and HANNA feels the mattress compress as MARISSA sits on the bed. She looks at the shoes as she hears her call.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lewis. It's Marissa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hears the name. The name of the woman she thought she had killed. Her face pale in shock and fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got anything? He's coming here. I can smell it. Double the men. But, Lewis, I want to talk to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hears MARISSA hang. Another pair of shoes enter the room. Male. ISAACS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His name's Klaus Knepfler. He used to send Heller's things from Berlin before the Communists were kicked out of Prague.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much does he know about the programme?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything. He knew Johanna.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does he know about the child?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He also thinks Erik's the father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well that's good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody thinks Erik's her father. Erik probably thinks he's her father. They snigger. HANNA's eyes widen in shock. She can barely control her breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crazy bastard. You got a fix on him yet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's see what else Knepfler has to offer. He leaves her. MARISSA suddenly senses something. Did she hear an intake of breath? She turns and quickly looks under the bed. No one there. Her imagination maybe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stands and we see the shoes walk away to the door. They reach the door. HANNA, clinging to the bedsprings in mid- air, not breathing. The green shoes leave. HANNA breathes. Hurriedly she climbs out from under the bed and goes to a window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WILHELM GRIMM'S HOUSE - DAY 165 HANNA lands having jumped from the window. She looks around quickly. Then, out of sight from the cars at the front of the house, she runs for dear life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BERLIN STREET - DAY 166 HANNA walking fast, in total shock and confusion. Who is she? She walks head down, determined not to be seen. Not knowing where she is going. Her world turned upside down. She sees an internet cafe. Ducks into it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INTERNET CAFE. BERLIN - DAY 167 HANNA sits down at a computer. The young OWNER comes up to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me. You have to pay first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Euros for half an hour. She looks at the money that Knepfler gave her. It contains Euros. She hands some over to the OWNER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How does it work?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've never used the internet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. He smiles in amazement and logs on for her. The owner brings up a search engine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just type whatever it is you're looking for here. He walks away and HANNA slowly starts to type. She types in
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AMUSEMENT PARK/WILHELM GRIMM'S HOUSE - DAY 168 ERIK HELLER limps, head bowed, through the Amusement Park. He suddenly stops dead and ducks behind a fallen fibreglass dinosaur as he sees two CIA AGENTS sitting in a car outside the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: watches for a moment or two. Then, keeping low, he makes a painful run towards the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: throws himself against the back wall of the kitchen. He breathes heavily for a moment, clutching his wounded leg. He turns and rises to look through the kitchen window. Inside he sees KNEPFLER, stripped to the waist his body bloodied, hanging upside down from a meat hook. He's obviously dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: crouches back down against the wall, thinking furiously. Then, decision made, he checks sight lines and runs back across the Amusement Park away from the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INTERNET CAFE. BERLIN - DAY 169 HANNA sits at the computer, looking at the screen breathless with tension. Phrases from the text leap out at her. aAn interfering sequence within the DNAa , aintervention to the mother's uterus during pregnancy.a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stands in shock. She reads again. aIntervention to the mother's uterusa
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: deletes the page. Sits in shock. Then writes in her mother's name. JOHANNA ZADEK. Immediately the article about JOHANNA's death comes up. HANNA stares at it. She reads it. No mention of a child. There is an address for Johanna Zadek. She came from the Heizinger Buildings area in the suburbs of East Berlin. HANNA writes it down. Gets up and leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TAXI. EAST BERLIN SUBURB - DAY 170 HANNA sits in the back of a taxi as it takes her into a grim concrete jungle of old East German housing projects.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at the thousands of tiny windows, so many lives being lived in unawareness. Is this normality? Is this the world she longed to be a part of?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GRANDMA'S ROOM. WILHELM'S HOUSE. BERLIN - DAY 171 MARISSA and ISAACS wait in Grandma's Room. ISAAC's phone rings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isaacs. He listens. Puts the phone down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A public computer at a Berlin internet cafe just did a web search for aDNA Interfering Sequencea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hanna?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Next they searched the name Johanna Zadek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stops dead. Looks at ISAACS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's not coming here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KATRIN ZADEK'S APARTMENT BLOCK. EAST BERLIN HOUSING 172 PROJECTS - DAY HANNA gets out of the taxi and looks up at an enormous grey housing block - the Heizinger building. She approaches the entrance and looks on all the buzzers. Sees a name scrawled on one - Number 14. Zadek. She presses the buzzer. Waits. No answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: come out the block and HANNA catches the door and enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HALL. KATRIN ZADEK'S APARTMENT BLOCK - DAY 173 HANNA knocks at the door of number 14, waits, knocks again, louder. No reply. A door further along opens. Kurdish music pours out. A KURDISH WOMAN wrapped in shawls emerges pushing a pram. She's followed by her two other CHILDREN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (In German w/ English
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me. I'm looking for Joanna Zadek's house. Can you help? The KURDISH WOMAN wont look HANNA in the eye as she passes. She mutters her response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (In Kurdish w/ English
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't speak German.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: kicks at the door but knows it won't be answered so doesn't wait.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KATRIN ZADEK'S APARTMENT. EAST BERLIN HOUSING 174 PROJECT - DAY HANNA walks round to the back door of the apartment and approaches the kitchen window. She peers through. On first inspection the kitchen seems undisturbed. Then HANNA sees the framed photograph of JOANNA on the wall. Blood splattered across the glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: quickly moves to the door, tries to force it. She looks around, no-one's coming. With a sharp kick she smashes the glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KATRIN ZADEK'S APARTMENT - DAY 175 HANNA climbs through the broken glass into the kitchen. The air is thick with the buzz of Bluebottle flies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sees the photograph of JOANNA. With some trepidation she moves round the kitchen table and sees the body of KATRIN ZADEK. The back of KATRIN'S head is blown clean away. The flies have laid their eggs in the bloody mess of her brain that spreads across the cheap lino floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: steps back and gags. She backs out of the kitchen and into the hall. Turns and goes through into the lounge. The lounge has been over thrown. Cushions ripped, shelving pulled down. HANNA stares at the destruction wrought by
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hunt for information.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turns, walks back down the hall and passes a door to a tiny second bedroom. She stops and enters. The room had been turned into a home office, there are newspaper clippings relating to JOANNA'S MURDER and photographs of JOANNA herself covering every available wall space. A testament to KATRIN'S unremitting search for the truth behind her daughters murder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: begins to search the room for clues. Anything that will help her understand who she is and where she came from. Then suddenly she hears a quiet familiar voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) You won't find anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turns in shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marissa would have been much too careful for that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares at him. ERIK HELLER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sit down Hanna.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you my father?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sit down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you my father?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you? Moment of electric silence between them. ERIK does nothing but she knows the answer is no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was going to tell you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sinks to the floor. Breathing fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong with me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: flinches slightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where was I born?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: knows he has to tell the truth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At Galinka.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was a secret CIA research programme in rural Poland.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What kind of research?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares at ERIK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was run by Marissa Wiegler. The science came from the old East Germany. The money from the CIA. The intention was to explore whether small genetic changes could be made to embryos... to improve
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) Improve?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at her. She looks so young, so numb, so lost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reduce capacity for fear. For pity. Increase muscle strength. Heighten senses. Anything that might make a better soldier.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks up, stares at him. It's her he's talking about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did you know about it? ERIK's stares right at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I worked for it. She stares at him. He hands her a piece of paper from his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is what you were looking for.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: reads. It is an invitation to Johanna Zadek to participate in the Galinka project. A projected date of arrival at the Galinka Centre. A date - 23rd February 1995. An agreed fee to be paid to Johanna. Five hundred American dollars. An agreement to give up the child and have no legal claim over it. The letter is signed by Erik Heller.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I recruited your mother at an abortion clinic in May 1994. She was about to terminate an unwanted pregnancy. Some boy at a disco.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at the paper in shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had recruited twenty women. She was the last. She was different. Two years later I heard the programme was to be terminated. The research adisposed ofa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Disposed of?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I tried to save all of you. But you were the only one I was able to rescue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stands in shock. She reaches to the window of the room to get some air. She is reeling - faint.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hanna listen to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep away from me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: approaches her. With real conviction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It worked. You worked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean I'm a killer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... no.. He makes to touch her. HANNA springs back in violent repulsion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't touch me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have a new identity for you. A new life. A new beginning. She stares at him, then pushes past him. ERIK stops, pushes her back but then HANNA grabs a sharp letter opener.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't. She attacks, ERIK pushes her to one side, grabs her. A fight in the apartment. Chaos, photos of Johanna crashing, lamps and bookshelves falling. HANNA murderous, ERIK just defending himself, not willing to hurt her. But then she overpowers him, has a knife to his throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me go. He releases her. She goes to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I tried to prepare you for what your life would be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't prepare me for this. And her look is so full of pain that in that moment ERIK knows he has done a terrible wrong. She starts to leave down the fire escape. ERIK calls after her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hanna wait. He looks out to watch her go. It's then ERIK sees the cars coming across the estate scrubland.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turns in panic. And dashes back into the apartment, runs through the destroyed living room, and out through the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: comes out of the main entrance and runs into full view of the cars, deliberately distracting them from HANNA.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MARISSA'S CAR. CONT. 177 MARISSA's car is a about to turn the corner and bump straight into HANNA when suddenly...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sees ERIK leaving the front of the apartment block. She speaks to ISAACS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's him. And the car swerves to follow him. Thus moving unknowingly away from the slight figure of HANNA. HANNA can see the cars in full chase of Erik Heller. He has distracted them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . STREET. EAST BERLIN. 178 HELLER sprints fast across the wasteland. Incredible athleticism. He dives down a side alley, losing his pursuers for a second. Takes out a gun, looking for Marissa. Looking to finish it off. Just as he has done this ISAACS' HENCHMAN approach from the end of the street. HELLER fires in their direction, starts to run down an alley. He vaults a dividing wall, scratching himself on barbed wire. He sprints round a corner and sees a doorway ahead of him. He walks towards the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.C.) Drop it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: steps out of the doorway, her gun trained on him. There are men at the end of the alleyway. No escape. HELLER drops his gun. Silence between them. He turns to look her in the eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So go ahead. She stares at him. Wants to make this as painful as she can for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know I'll find her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't under estimate what you created.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What we created, together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ESTATE BUILDINGS - CONTINUOUS 179 HANNA is walking fast across the grim grey estate to a main road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . STREET. EAST BERLIN - CONTINUOUS 180 MARISSA with her gun still at ERIK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Truth is I was always very fond of you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ESTATE BUILDINGS - CONTINUOUS 181 CLOSE ON - HANNA continuing to walk away. She hears a single gun shot. Stops dead. Knows what it means. An intense conflict of emotions inside her. Her breathing stops for a moment, her world seems to go silent. Then a car flies by on the main road, almost running her over, and she is woken. She sees a bus stop ahead. On auto- pilot she runs to it, a bus coming, she beckons. It stops and she is on board.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WASTELAND. EAST BERLIN. 182 MARISSA stands over the dead body of ERIK HELLER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave him here. And they all walk away leaving him alone in the East Berlin dirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUS, EAST BERLIN. 183 HANNA on the bus. Shaking from the shock of his death, bloodied slightly from the fight. The other passengers stare at her as she forces back the tears. HANNA reaches in her pocket for a handkerchief, but only pulls out the letter Erik showed her. The Galinka letter. She sees the address. Galinka, Ostrovska district, Poland.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: makes a decision. She is going back to where she was born. She must find out who she is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ESTATE BUILDING. KATRIN ZADEK'S FLAT. 184 MARISSA enters the apartment. And looks at the chaos. ISAACS comes up behind her. HENCHMEN at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They had a fight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She must know the truth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where do you think she's gone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where would you go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turns to ISAACS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm closing the CIA operation down. Heller is dead, that's all that matters to them. This we do alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . POLISH TRAIN. 185 HANNA's head rests on the backrest of a train-seat as the train crawls through the Polish/German border. Exhausted, many nights without sleep. Hungry but unable to eat. Needing resolution. In the same carriage a Polish woman sleeps alongside her child of two, also sleeping. HANNA looks at the child. The peace of the innocent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . POLISH TRAIN STATION. NIGHT. 186 The train entering a Polish train station. The town is called Ostrovska. Freezing cold. The town is in the North of Poland and it's very poor. Industrial. Bleak. HANNA exits, approaches a station guard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am looking for a train to Galinka.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galinka is a small village. No trains. You must wait for bus in the morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where can I stay? He points. HANNA sees the hotel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . POLISH HOTEL. BEDROOM. NIGHT. 187 HANNA enters the tiny, dank hotel room. She looks at the filthy carpet, the grey ceiling. She turns on the tiny TV. Cartoons. Tom and Jerry type stuff. But she doesn't laugh. She flicks channel. Then stands dead still. She is looking at
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: HELLER's dead body on the ground. The report depicts him as a dangerous criminal. HANNA stares at the image. The death of the man she spent her life with. Lost forever. HANNA's face oddly still in the TV flicker. Then she flicks it off. Leaves the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . POLISH HOTEL. FOYER/BAR - NIGHT. 188 HANNA, exhausted, sleepless and starving, comes down the shabby hotel stairs and enters the hotel bar. Grim. Empty room, old carpet, bad smell, dated pop music. Three hard- drinking men stare at her, making her uncomfortable as she goes to the bar. A forty-five year old BUSINESSMAN stands there, drinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have a sandwich?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kitchen is closed. The BUSINESSMAN speaks in German.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get her something. Poor girl's hungry. The barman disappears. HANNA looks round, waits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm from Leipzig.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: flinches at the name. Leipzig.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The same.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Business? He looks at her body. HANNA senses it. Her sandwich arrives. It's grim. She leaves it, walks out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am tired. I need to sleep. She leaves the bar. HANNA walks back up the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? She walks along the corridor, gets to her room. BUSINESSMAN follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was just making nice conversation. Yes? As she enters her room, he puts his foot in the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's talk. Maybe we can do business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: kicks his foot out of the door. Hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't like talk, huh? He barges into the room and grabs her. Tries to push her on to the bed. He is strong. His words and tone contrasting violently with his actions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be nice. Be a nice little dolly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is thrust on to the bed, but suddenly turns him over her head and smashes him against a cupboard. BUSINESSMAN grabs her hair and throws her on the bed. But now HANNA snaps. She starts to roar. It's like an animal, like nothing we have seen before. She rips at his face, grabs a glass, smashes it and cuts his face with it. Pure animal rage. BUSINESSMAN starts to scream, blood pouring from his eyes. He collapses on the floor. She kicks him, punches him, repeatedly in a grief-fuelled rage until she is spent of her primal fury and falls, panting, to the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . When she looks up she sees his mangled bloody body lying next to her. Not quite dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: suddenly recoils in horror. Shocked by the viciousness of her actions. Tears begins to run down her cheeks as HANNA grabs the man's wallet, and leaves the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . POLISH STREET - NIGHT 189 Shaking in shock, HANNAH walks out of the hotel and down the street, in a daze, no idea where she is going. She starts to run, faster and faster, just running to run out of herself. Finally she stops and is sick. She looks up. A taxi's yellow light blinks in the darkness. She looks at the businessman's wallet to see how much money is in there. She approaches the taxi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have this much. Can you take me to Galinka?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . POLISH HILL ROAD - NIGHT 190 HANNA is in the taxi as it travels a lonely Polish forest road through undulating snow-covered hills. Cold dawn is arriving. Grey skies lightening through the windscreen. Tall snowy pines tower above the car. No one else on the road, just a horse drawn cart guiding cows to pasture. It is as if from a different age. Quiet, solitary. HANNA checks the paper in her pocket. Still there. Blood on her hands from the businessman. A cut in her arm. Carefully, secretly, she wipes it clean. Suddenly the taxi stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is as far as the money gets you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks out. Middle of nowhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much further?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twelve miles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please. But no smile from him, nothing. HANNA gets out. Starts to walk as the taxi turns and drives back the way it came.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She is alone in the forest, freezing, shattered, hungry. Just about dawn. Cold as hell. She hears a car approach. Tries to hail it but it flies past fast. Blows icy air in her face. She continues in the freezing cold - sees the road ahead. It's hilly, winding, she isn't going to make it. Too tired. Too shattered. Time passes. Still she walks. Dead on her feet. Gathering every ounce of energy. Then the sounds of another car. But it too just flies by, ignoring her waves and cries.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: almost collapses in frustration. But carries on. Carries on walking. Time passes. Freezing cold. HANNA alone on the road. Can she make it? Then another car. HANNA turns, waves, cries out. And, almost magically, the car slows and stops. The window winds down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to Galinka. Can you help me? A woman's voice, German, in German.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Yes I can take you there. And as HANNA gets in, she looks at the comforting, smiling face of MARISSA WIEGLER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAR. POLAND. ROAD TO GALINKA - NIGHT 191 MARISSA starts to drive, HANNA sits in the front with her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: has no idea who she is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: speaks in perfect German. Calm, soft, comforting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a very dull place Galinka. Why would you want to go there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was born there. But I've never really seen it. Why are you going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have some business to sort out. She looks at her and smiles a sunny, uncomplicated smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's very lucky we ran into each other, don't you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've hurt your arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hands her some tissue. HANNA bandages the arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm Astrid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not German. Are you American?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right. I lived there for many years. I travel a lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles at her kindly. HANNA feels safe for the first time in ages. She feels the tears come.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh dear, what's wrong with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay. Are you in trouble?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: nods. She fights the tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gently holds her hand as she drives. HANNA weeping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What sort of trouble?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (though her tears) I don't know what to do. Nothing is what I thought it would be. It's... ugly and cruel and I don't know where to go, or... I'm stupid. I don't know what I expected...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: secretly, genuinely affected by this. Fights the emotion that has surprised her. Human warmth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sometimes I feel the same way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: eyes her, surprised to hear this from a grown up woman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: puts on some music. Gentle. Bach maybe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like music.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sleep why don't you? You look very tired. It will take half an hour on this road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: nods. She begins to drift off, so long since she has slept. Her eyes fall shut and her head rests against the window. She is asleep. Vulnerable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RURAL ROAD - DAWN 192 Soft dawn light as MARISSA drives on a narrow rural road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAR - DAWN 193 MARISSA looks at the sleeping HANNA. MARISSA represses her gathering emotion. HANNA suddenly looking so young as she sleeps the sleep of the innocent. The rush of emotion shocks her - she is watching HANNA, not the road - and she veers off, nearly crashing the car, narrowly avoiding a tree. She puts her foot sharply on the brake. She's wearing the same
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as she wore at Wilhelm's House.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is jolted awake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are we?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: calms herself instantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nearly there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: doesn't see MARISSA'S SHOES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GALINKA 194 MARISSA's car slows as it enters a tiny deserted hamlet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) This is it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MARISSA'S CAR. 195 HANNA looks around. There is not much to Galinka. She is confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's so small.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Just a few cottages. And the old bunker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: chooses not to ask any more questions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you for the ride. You're very kind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wish there was more I could do for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks kindly at HANNA who is confused by the intimacy. MARISSA reaches into the glove compartment and retrieves a torch which she hands to HANNA.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here, take this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: switches the torch on and off, thinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope you find what you're looking for.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. She gets out and shuts the door behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GALINKA. CONT. 196 HANNA looks around at the grey desolation, rural poverty, the ends of the earth. In the car MARISSA stares at her, then drives off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: walks through the trees along a track. Overgrown, not used for many years. She reaches a hidden entrance off the track. By the entrance there is an old battered sign. GALINKA. HANNA looks at the old iron gate. Rusted, locked. It has not been opened in a long time. She stares at the sign, tries the gate - yes, locked. Then she climbs the gate. She nearly tears her clothes on the spikes at the top of the gate, then leaps over and, exhausted, four days without real sleep, begins to walk up the narrow tree-lined driveway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GALINKA BUNKER - CONTINUOUS 197 HANNA approaches the gaping mouth of an underground bunker. She stops, looks down at the torch in her hand, switches it on and walks into the darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TUNNELS. GALINKA - CONTINUOUS 198 With only the torch light to see by HANNA treads warily deeper into the tunnels as, behind her, the small aperture of daylight recedes slowly to nothing. The tunnels seem to stretch on for miles ahead of her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: reaches a junction where four tunnels meet. She shines her torch down each tunnel, trying to decide which way to go. She stops when she sees, a little way down one of the tunnels, a child's forgotten shoe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: steps forward and shines her torch down at the tiny red shoe, its buckle rusted. She walks on into the dark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: finds a door which she pushes at. The door is stiff, but HANNA uses her full weight and soon she's made enough of a gap to squeeze through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NURSERY. GALINKA - CONTINUOUS 199 At first HANNA has difficulty making out where she is, but dotted here and there are parts of an old nursery. The walls are painted with a blue sky, clouds and the figures of children holding hands. She begins to remember as, from a distant place, she hears the sound of children laughing. She shines her torch in the direction of the laughter and catches a glimpse of a child, dressed in a party frock and hat, playing hide and seek. She shines her torch the other way, and there's another, then a third and a fourth. For a moment the room seems to be filled with laughing children. Then, in an instant, they're gone again and silence returns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: lit only be the reflected light of her torch, knows she has been here before. She walks on through the tunnels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DORMITORY. GALINKA - CONTINUOUS 200 HANNA enters a long hall which was once the children's dormitory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . At one end is a steep pile of metal bed frames. From a distant place in her memory HANNA begins to hear the sound of children singing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Happy Birthday to you, Happy Birthday to you... From the far end of the dormitory come a procession of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the first of whom is carrying a large birthday cake lit with birthday candles. The children's faces glow eerily in the candle light. They're looking at HANNA and walking straight towards her as they sing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Happy Biirrrrthday, dear... The CHILDREN arrive at HANNA lifting the cake towards her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Hanna. Happy Birthday to you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: leans forward, takes a deep breath and blows. The children disappear with the flames of the candles. The sound of a woman's approaching footsteps echo through the tunnel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: swings her torch beam in the direction of the footsteps. She freezes as she sees a pair of GREEN SHOES walking towards her. The same shoes as in Wilhelm's house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: raises her torch beam to see the face of the woman from the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're Marissa Wiegler.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: starts to shake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: has her gun pointing at HANNA but her expression is the same sunny, uncomplicated smile as earlier. Dead silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: breathing fast. MARISSA speaks in English.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry sweetie. I don't want to hurt you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: tone has turned into a twisted interpretation of maternal care.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: does not move. Like a wild animal cornered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could have killed you already when you were asleep in the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: still shaking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: now sees ISAACS and his HENCHMEN, three of them, all with hunting rifles. All ready to shoot her should she attack or run. They are some distance away, not coming any closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did Erik tell you about this place?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are the other children? She looks at MARISSA, who waits, then answers quietly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sleeping. They're all sleeping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't believe you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can protect you, Hanna. Make sure you walk out of here and keep walking. Grow up and grow old in safety and security. No one need know a thing. But you have to trust me. You can't talk about this with anyone. It's what we call aclassified.a If you tell anyone, it'll be dangerous for both of us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at her, remembering what ERIK told her, trying hard not to succumb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You killed my mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're mother didn't want you, sweetie. I saved you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: just stares, not believing her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm the only person left who understands who you are. The only one who cares.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: holds out a hand to HANNA, for HANNA to take, a motherly gesture...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I practically am your mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stomach turns in horror. She switches off her torch and runs into the shadows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: raises his gun fires.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TUNNELS. GALINKA - CONTINUOUS 201 HANNA running through the darkness. Behind her ISAACS and the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: come after her. ISAACS carries a large heavy torch, as does one of the HENCHMEN. The other HENCHMEN all have night vision on their rifles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: crouches down, she sniffs the air, can smell them coming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: treads carefully down the tunnel. We see his point of view through his night vision sight, just the dark tunnel stretching on. Like a ghost HANNA'S face appears up close, her eyes a pearly white. She slams the gun back in the HENCHMAN'S face. Still in night vision we see the fight, quick and hard. The flash of a single bullet illuminates his death. Silence once more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: now has the first HENCHMAN'S rifle. From around the corner into the next tunnel she hears the sound of feet on dirt. She presses herself against the tunnel, waits listening, hears the feet again and in one movement raises the rifle and spins round the corner. Through her night vision sight she sees a deer, scared eyes staring back at her. She releases her grip on the trigger and the deer scampers into the darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LABORATORY. GALINKA - CONTINUOUS 202 HANNA comes into the old laboratory. Through her night vision sights we see the white tiles and smashed equipment. She senses someone coming after her and ducks behind a lab bench.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: enters the lab carrying a hand gun and a small torch. His footsteps make a crunching sound as he steps through the broken glass that litters the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rises from her hiding place and stands straight into the torch light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She fires but is off target and only catches the HENCHMAN'S left arm. He drops his torch which slides across the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: comes round the lab bench to where the HENCHMAN should be lying but he's gone. There's a trail of blood which she follows to a metal cabinet. She stops at the cabinet and fires three shots into its flimsy doors. The dead HENCHMAN slides out from the cabinet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: takes the dead man's hand gun and goes to retrieve the torch. She switches the torch off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TUNNELS. GALINKA. 203 ISAACS, unnerved, presses himself against the wall of the tunnel. He feels something at his legs. Points his torch to find the deer pulling at his trouser leg. He shoots it. Then runs further down into the tunnel. Alerted by the sound of ISAACS' shot HANNA starts to pursue her prey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DORMITORY. GALINKA. 204 ISAACS is back in the dormitory. With torch in hand he searches under the beds. Behind him he hears HANNA enter. He switches off his torch and crawls under a bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: walks slowly between the beds. Under the bed ISAACS is preparing to fire, now watching her feet. Suddenly the bed he's under is lifted straight up in the air and off him - HANNA has summoned enormous strength and is clutching the end of the bed. He fires, hits nothing and she lets go - the bed comes crashing down on him again. His torch rolls away. His arms are trapped under the bed, he's unable to move. With all his might ISAACS pushes at the bed and lifts it off himself. They fight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: picks up the torch and slams the torch across his temple. She grabs him by the hair and smashes his head repeatedly into the floor - BAM - BAM - BAM - BAM - BAM. Silence - he's dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits back on the bed and looks at her bloodied hands - looks down at what she's done. Shocked by her own violence she begins to cry hot tears of bewilderment. She gets up and runs from the dormitory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TUNNELS/TUNNEL MOUTH. GALINKA - CONTINUOUS 205 HANNA runs back through the tunnels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No more. No more. Tears are streaming down her face as she reaches sight of the tunnel mouth and the daylight beyond. Standing in silhouette is MARISSA. HANNA slows her pace and stops when she can see the white of MARISSA'S eyes and the finger on MARISSA'S trigger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: raises the gun and aims at HANNA - but HANNA comes forward again, walking calmly towards her. She stops and drops her gun to the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything I see is nothing I want.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at HANNA, her gentle, childlike countenance. She smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me take care of you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I don't want that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turns her back on MARISSA and starts to walks in the opposite direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: watches her walk away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: walks waiting for the shot to come.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hanna.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: spins, fires directly at CAMERA.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOREST. NORTH SWEDEN. 206 FADE UP: The sun spreads its golden fingers through the trees catching the early morning dew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A wide shot of the HANNA'S cabin, wisps of smoke rise from it's chimney.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: steps out of the cabin. She's back wearing her furs again. In her hands she carries a cup of hot milk and a small wooden bowl. In VOICE-OVER we hear HANNA reading from her beloved Encyclopaedia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits down on a tree trunk outside the cabin and pours some milk into the bowl, then drinks a little for herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) Home to millions of species, including humans, Earth is the only place in the universe where life is known to exist. She raises her head and makes a small clicking sound. Her friend, the snow fox, appears from the trees. The fox now has a small family of cubs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: watches as the cubs approach the milk and begin to drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) The planet formed over four and a half billion years ago, and life appeared on its surface within a billion years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits back and feels the sunlight on her face. Above her the trees are beginning to leaf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) It is expected to continue supporting life for another one and a half billion years, after which the rising luminosity of the Sun will eliminate it all.
direction.name: direction
